title: American University of Beirut (AUB)-HAS2 Cardiovascular Risk Index
description: Stratifies cardiovascular risk of patients undergoing noncardiac surgery using 6 easily obtainable clinical variables with superior discriminatory power compared to other risk indices.

parameters.name: history_heart_disease
parameters.description: History of heart disease including ischemic heart disease, congestive heart failure, or other cardiac conditions

parameters.name: symptoms_angina_dyspnea
parameters.description: Symptoms of angina or dyspnea (shortness of breath) suggesting cardiac or pulmonary compromise

parameters.name: anemia_hgb_less_12
parameters.description: Anemia defined as hemoglobin less than 12 mg/dL

parameters.name: vascular_surgery
parameters.description: Surgery involving vascular procedures (higher risk surgery type)

ranges.interpretation: Very low risk of major cardiovascular events (death, myocardial infarction, or stroke) within 30 days after surgery. Event rate <1%. Routine perioperative management without additional cardiac monitoring or interventions.
Moderate risk of major cardiovascular events within 30 days after surgery. Event rate 5-11%. Consider enhanced perioperative monitoring and cardiac consultation for optimization of medical therapy.

High risk of major cardiovascular events within 30 days after surgery. Event rate >15%. Recommend preoperative cardiac consultation, optimization of medical therapy, enhanced perioperative monitoring, and consideration of postoperative ICU care.

references: Dakik H, Chehab O, Eldirani M, Soud M, Kassas I, Almedani S, et al. A New Index for Pre-Operative Cardiovascular Evaluation. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2019 Jul 9;73(26):3067-3078. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2019.04.023.

Dakik H, Sbaity E, Msheik A, Kasmar A, Chehab O, Tamim H. AUB-HAS2 Cardiovascular Risk Index: Performance in Surgical Subpopulations and Comparison to the Revised Cardiac Risk Index. J Am Heart Assoc. 2020 May 19;9(10):e016228. doi: 10.1161/JAHA.119.016228.

Dakik H, Eldirani M, Kaspar C, Chehab O, Sbaity E, Msheik A, et al. Prospective Validation of the AUB-HAS2 Cardiovascular Risk Index. Eur Heart J Qual Care Clin Outcomes. 2021 Jan 8;7(1):96-97. doi: 10.1093/ehjqcco/qcaa077.
formula: AUB-HAS2 Score = Sum of present risk factors: History of heart disease (1 point) + Age ≥75 years (1 point) + Symptoms of angina/dyspnea (1 point) + Anemia Hgb <12 mg/dL (1 point) + Vascular surgery (1 point) + Emergency surgery (1 point). Total range: 0-6 points.
notes: The AUB-HAS2 index demonstrated superior discriminatory power compared to the Revised Cardiac Risk Index (RCRI) in large validation studies.
The index can stratify patients into low (0-1 points), intermediate (2-3 points), and high risk (>3 points) categories with strong predictive ability (AUC 0.82-0.90).
Each risk factor contributes equally (1 point each) to the total score, making it simple to calculate and remember.
The score predicts 30-day major cardiovascular events (death, myocardial infarction, or stroke) after noncardiac surgery.
Validated in over 1 million patients from the American College of Surgeons National Surgical Quality Improvement Program database.
The HAS2 acronym represents: Heart disease, Age ≥75, Symptoms, and 2 additional factors (anemia and Surgery type).
